Given the importance of the historical record, and the fact that that some of our digitised collections include materials that are sensitive to particular communities and groups, we ask that any use of the digitised collections is undertaken with the appropriate care. notesStmt.note: Defective at the beginning. Signs of worming. A long lacuna after folio 1.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Fragments of the commentary on the Pentateuch based on the works of Eleazar of Worms.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Small Italian semi-cursive script, unpunctuated, of the 16th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Ele'azar of Worms. Commentary on the Pentateuch. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Or. 5065.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Fischel Hirsch: purchased by the British Museum from him on 16 July 1896 (back flyleaf [xxxvi]v).
